title: Rent & Housing Prices in Iraq
content:
The cost of rent in Iraq can vary greatly depending on the location, with average monthly rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center ranging from $200 to $500 USD, approximately 250,000 to 625,000 IQD.

[FACTBOX]
GDP per Capita (PPP): $14,464
Affordability Rating: Moderate
Average Monthly Rent (1BR, City Center): $350 USD / 437,500 IQD
Average Monthly Rent (1BR, Outside Center): $150 USD / 187,500 IQD
Property Purchase (per sqm, City Center): $1,500 USD
Currency: IQD
[/FACTBOX]

[SECTION] Housing Market Overview [/SECTION]
Iraq's housing market has experienced significant growth in recent years, driven by government investments in infrastructure and a growing economy. The rental market is relatively **unregulated**, with typical lease terms ranging from 6 to 12 months. Deposits are usually required, equivalent to one or two months' rent, and tenant rights are limited. Compared to regional neighbors, Iraq's housing costs are relatively **affordable**, with prices lower than in Turkey or Iran, but higher than in Jordan or Syria. However, the market is still **volatile**, with prices fluctuating depending on the location and condition of the property.

The housing market in Iraq is also influenced by the country's **security situation**, with prices varying greatly depending on the level of safety and stability in different areas. In general, the capital city of Baghdad and other major urban centers tend to have higher rents and property prices than smaller towns and rural areas. Despite these challenges, the Iraqi government has implemented various initiatives to **stimulate the housing market**, including subsidies for low-income families and investments in new housing developments.

[SECTION] Apartment Rental Prices [/SECTION]
[TABLE]
| Apartment Type | City Center (USD/month) | Outside Center (USD/month) | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Studio / Bedsitter | $150-$300 | $80-$150 | Basic amenities, shared facilities |
| 1 Bedroom | $200-$400 | $100-$250 | Furnished, air-conditioned, moderate quality |
| 2 Bedroom | $350-$600 | $200-$400 | Spacious, modern amenities, family-friendly |
| 3 Bedroom | $500-$1,000 | $350-$700 | Luxury finishes, high-end amenities, secure complexes |
[/TABLE]

[SECTION] Property Purchase Prices [/SECTION]
[TABLE]
| Area Type | Price per sqm (USD) | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- |
| City Center | $1,500-$3,000 | Prime locations, modern developments, high demand |
| Suburbs | $800-$1,500 | Residential areas, family-friendly, moderate prices |
| Rural | $200-$500 | Agricultural areas, limited amenities, low prices |
[/TABLE]

[SECTION] Best Neighborhoods for Expats [/SECTION]
- **Karrada**: a upscale neighborhood in central Baghdad, with modern amenities and high-end housing options, rents ranging from $500 to $1,500 USD per month.
- **Mansour**: a secure and family-friendly neighborhood in western Baghdad, with spacious apartments and villas, rents ranging from $300 to $800 USD per month.
- **Dora**: a residential neighborhood in southern Baghdad, with affordable housing options and basic amenities, rents ranging from $150 to $300 USD per month.
- **Erbil**: a safe and modern city in the Kurdistan region, with a growing expat community and high-end housing options, rents ranging from $400 to $1,200 USD per month.
- **Basra**: a port city in southern Iraq, with a mix of modern and traditional housing options, rents ranging from $200 to $500 USD per month.

[SECTION] Renter Tips for Iraq [/SECTION]
- Research local neighborhoods and **security conditions** before signing a lease.
- **Negotiate** rent and amenities with the landlord, as prices are often flexible.
- Be aware of **scams** and **fake listings**, and always inspect the property before signing a lease.
- **Utilities** such as electricity and water are usually not included in the rent, and may require separate payment.
- **Furnished** apartments are common, but **unfurnished** options are also available, often at a lower rent.
- Consider working with a **local real estate agent** to find a suitable property and navigate the rental process.
